verses.roman:
viṣaya-jātīya sukha āmāra āsvāda
āmā haite koṭi-guṇa āśrayera āhlāda

synonyms: viṣaya jātīya—relating to the object; sukha—happiness; āmāra—My; āsvāda—tasting; āmā haite—than Me; koṭi-guṇa—ten million times more; āśrayera—of the abode; āhlāda—pleasure.
translation: "I taste the bliss to which the object of love is entitled. But the pleasure of Rādhā, the abode of that love, is ten million times greater.
